p: Many other feeding management strategies that can reduce greenhouse gas emissions without compromising animal welfare could be better emphasized and further explored. These include improving silage quality with more effective preservation methods [ 10]; adding dietary fats, such as coconut, linseed, soybean, or sunflower seed oils [ 184, 185, 186]; changes to pasture management such as matching grazing intensity and pasture quality [ 173, 187] supplementation of the diet with enzymes [ 122, 188] or yeasts [ 189], and precision feeding (better agreement between the supply of N in the diet and requirements of the animal, in order to reduce N excretion) [ 190, 191], to name just a few.
